intro: Agelanthus sansibarensis subsp. sansibarensis, commonly known as the East African spurge, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of Tanzania and Kenya. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, milky sap and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal dunes and rocky habitats. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
